content:
The coronavirus pandemic caused many Americans to feel isolated for days and months on end. In fact, this past year, claims of anxiety and depression among Americans has jumped from one in five to two in five. After such a difficult year, Mental Health Awareness Month is a timely reminder to check in on your loved ones and make sure they're doing okay. No one should face silent battles alone.

If you are personally struggling with feelings of hopelessness or having suicidal thoughts, help is available immediately through the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline. To chat with a counselor now, call 1-800-273-TALK or visit suicidepreventionlifeline.org.
name: Tom Cole
text: coronavirus pandemic caused many americans feel isolated days months end fact past year claims anxiety depression among americans jumped one five two five difficult year mental health awareness month timely reminder check loved ones make sure theyre okay one face silent battles aloneif personally struggling feelings hopelessness suicidal thoughts help available immediately national suicide prevention lifeline chat counselor call 1800273talk visit suicidepreventionlifelineorg

content:
This week I spoke on the House floor to mark the 100th anniversary of the #TulsaMassacre in which hundreds of African Americans were killed by a white lynch mob – thousands were made homeless and #BlackWallStreet – the thriving Greenwood community in Tulsa was destroyed.

Join me and Members of the Congressional Black Caucus on Thursday, May 27 for a discussion of this forgotten history and what it means for us today in an era of social justice, reconciliation and reparations.

Sign up here to join the conversation: https://ushr.zoomgov.com/webinar/register/WN_DJlpPxR5TjO9RKpYr-AJoA

YOUTUBE.COM
www.youtube.com
name: Henry C. "Hank" Johnson, Jr.
text: week spoke house floor mark 100th anniversary tulsamassacre hundreds african americans killed white lynch mob thousands made homeless blackwallstreet thriving greenwood community tulsa destroyedjoin members congressional black caucus thursday may discussion forgotten history means us today era social justice reconciliation reparationssign join conversation youtubecomwwwyoutubecom

content:
It is imperative we protect the Capitol and ensure the events of January 6 never happen again.

Tune in now as Chair Rosa DeLauro joins House Speaker Nancy Pelosi to discuss the $1.9 billion emergency security supplemental to respond to January 6.

https://www.c-span.org/video/?511896-1/speaker-pelosi-holds-news-conference-january-6-commission&live
